intro: Ariocarpus trigonus var. horacekii, commonly known as the "Cactus of the Holy Grail," is a rare and highly sought-after cactus species native to the Chihuahuan Desert in Mexico. It is characterized by its unique, flattened, ribbed stems that resemble a star or a wheel, with a smooth, pale green surface. The plant produces striking, bright yellow flowers during the spring, which are often short-lived but visually stunning. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, requiring minimal water. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is often cultivated by enthusiasts and is protected in its native habitat.
